description.value:
Descent into the Underworld
Mystic Rite • Level 3

Time: 8 hours
Cost: 5 Gnosis
Requirement: A spiritually resonant site associated with death, ancestry, or passage (such as a grave-site, ancestor shrine, or deep Umbral locus)

Description

The Descent into the Underworld is a perilous rite through which a Garou sends their spirit beyond the living world to confront death, memory, and shadow. Through extended ritual and surrender, the Garou's spirit passes into the Umbra's underworld, where truths are revealed that cannot be learned among the living.

This Rite is not a journey of the body. It is a journey of the self.

Effect

When the Gnosis cost is paid, the Rite succeeds automatically.

The Garou's spirit enters a deep Umbral state, mechanically treated as travel within the Ethereal Plane. Their physical body remains unconscious and helpless in the material world for the duration of the Rite.

The journey lasts up to 10 minutes of in-game time (Storyteller adjudication). During this time, the Garou experiences symbolic trials, encounters spirits of the dead or ancestral echoes, and confronts personal or spiritual truths.

Upon returning, choose two of the following outcomes:

Ancestral Communion — The Garou gains insight from spirits of the dead or ancestral echoes. Gain advantage on one Wisdom-based ability check or saving throw made within the next Caern Turn that directly relates to death, spirits, history, or legacy.

Revelation of the Shadow — The Garou confronts a difficult personal truth. Remove one non-magical mental effect caused by fear, despair, or doubt (Storyteller adjudication), or gain advantage on one Charisma-based ability check made to speak with spirits or the grieving within the next Caern Turn.

Mark of the Returned — The Garou returns visibly altered on a spiritual level. Spirits associated with death or ancestry recognize the Garou as one who has walked beyond life. Gain advantage on one social interaction with death aspected or ancestor spirits during the next Caern Turn.

Risks and Consequences

This Rite is profoundly taxing. A Garou cannot benefit from this Rite again until three Caern Turns have passed.

The Storyteller may introduce lingering narrative consequences, omens, or spiritual attention as a result of the journey.

Limitations

This Rite:

  • Does not resurrect the dead
  • Does not allow targeted contact with specific souls
  • Does not bind, compel, or control spirits
  • The Garou's body is vulnerable for the duration of the Rite
  • Each Garou must perform this Rite alone

"Those who walk among the dead return knowing why they still live."
